title: How to Make Chocolate Shortbread Cookies

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a medium-sized mixing bowl, add the flour, cocoa powder and salt. Use a spoon to stir the ingredients until they are mixed into a brown powder.

steps.headline: Whip butter using a standing or hand mixer.
steps.description: Place 1 cup (240 ml) of room temperature butter the bowl of a standing mixer, or a large mixing bowl. Beat the butter on medium speed with the attachment your standing mixer or hand mixer. If you don’t have an electric mixer, use a whisk and beat your butter vigorously. Keep in mind that beating your butter by hand will make your cookies come out softer and denser than if you used an electric mixer.

steps.headline: Whip the butter for around 5 minutes.
steps.description: Keep whipping the butter, scraping down the sides of the bowl if necessary, until the butter is fluffy and aerated, about five minutes. If you are whipping by hand, it will take five or so minutes longer to make the butter light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the sugar to the butter.
steps.description: After beating the butter for around five minutes, add the sugar to the butter mixture, pouring little by little while constantly beating with the electric mixer. Beat the sugar and butter together for around 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl using a spatula if the butter and sugar accumulate there. After 2 minutes, the butter and sugar mixture should look paler in color and fluffy.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla.
steps.description: After you have whipped the butter and sugar together, add in the vanilla extract if you wish. Vanilla extract adds to the flavor of the shortbread, but won’t overpower the chocolate. If you don’t want an additional element of flavor, skip this step.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients to the sugar and butter.
steps.description: Pour in the mixture of sugar, cocoa and salt into the mixing bowl of sugar and butter. Use the attachment of the standing mixer or your hand mixer to beat the ingredients on low speed.

steps.headline: Mix until dough is formed.
steps.description: Keep mixing the ingredients together with the standing or hand mixer until the flour and dry ingredients are just incorporated, and the dough sticks together when pressed, about three minutes.

methods.name: Shaping and Preparing the Dough for Baking

steps.headline: Make the dough into a disc.
steps.description: After you form a dough, take the dough out of the mixing bowl, scraping it off the sides if necessary. Place the dough on a cutting board and roll it into a ball shape. Then using a rolling pin to flatten the dough into a disc about ¾ inch (1.9 cm) thick. Use your fingers to round the edges of the disc.

steps.headline: Wrap and chill the dough.
steps.description: After you make the disc of dough, wrap it in plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for at least an hour. Chilling the dough will make the shortbread cookies a better consistency when baked.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven and prepare a baking sheet.
steps.description: Turn the oven up to 325 degrees F (162.7 C). While you are waiting for the oven to heat, line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Use the end of a stick of butter to lightly grease the parchment paper.

steps.headline: Make balls of dough and place them on the baking sheet.
steps.description: After you have chilled your dough ball, take it out of the refrigerator and break off chunks of the dough, either using your hands or a cookie scoop. Once you break off the dough, roll the dough pieces into balls that are about 1 inch (2.54 cm) in diameter. After you have finished making your balls of dough, place them on the greased parchment paper. Try not to over-handle your dough. Over-handling dough makes cookies that are dense, as opposed to crisp.

steps.headline: Tear off some dough and tack it onto a smaller ball of dough if one of your dough hunks is too large.
steps.description: If you want to make you chocolate shortbread cookies into fun shapes, don’t create balls of dough. Instead, use cookie cutters to punch out shapes in the disc of dough, and place the cookies on the greased parchment paper.

methods.name: Baking and Serving the Chocolate Shortbread Cookies

steps.headline: Place the 2 trays into the preheated oven.
steps.description: Make sure that your oven has preheated for at least fifteen minutes. Then place the two trays of cookies into the oven, putting one tray on the top rack and the other tray on the bottom rack.

steps.headline: Switch the trays after 10 minutes.
steps.description: Leave the cookie trays in the oven for about ten minutes. Then switch the trays, putting the top cookie tray on the bottom rack and putting the tray that was on the bottom rack on the top rack. Switching the trays ensures even baking.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for another ten or fifteen minutes.
steps.description: After you switch the trays, keep the cookies in the oven for another ten to fifteen minutes. Test if the cookies are done by poking a fork through a cookie. If the fork comes out clean, take the cookies out of the oven.

steps.headline: Place the cookies on a wire rack.
steps.description: After you take the cookies out of the oven, let them sit for about five minutes on the cooking tray. Then use a spatula to carefully lift each cookie off the tray and place it on a wire rack. If you don’t have a wire rack, lift the cookies up by the parchment paper and place them on the counter so that they cool faster.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the cookies with cocoa powder.
steps.description: If you wish, sprinkle each cookie with cocoa powder before you serve them. Sprinkling the cookies with cocoa powder gives them an extra element of flavor.

steps.headline: Serve the cookies when cooled.
steps.description: Once the cookies have settled, about 20-30 minutes, serve them and enjoy! Letting the cookies set for a little while helps them achieve the right texture. Store any leftover cookies in an airtight container. Cookies in a sealed container can last for up to 1 week.
